settings.question: How do I choose the best engagement ring?
settings.answer: Consider first your partner’s fashion sense, then the 4 Cs and finally your budget in that order. Settle on the diamond shape, setting style and metal type that best portrays her character.

settings.question: What is the most popular diamond shape for engagement rings?
settings.answer: The round brilliant is most favored due to its high sparkle levels. Others are princess and oval cuts along with cushion and emerald shapes.

settings.question: Are lab-grown diamonds a good choice for engagement rings?
settings.answer: Absolutely! They do look the same and serve the same purpose, the only difference is that they are more affordable and conserve nature.

settings.question: How much should I spend on an engagement ring?
settings.answer: There’s no stipulated limit at which one has to be concerned with. Instead of trying to fit in a prescribed amount, it will be wise to look for a ring that is affordable and emotionally valued.

settings.question: How can I measure my partner’s ring size?
settings.answer:
They can be measured by:

  • Using a ring-sizing instrument.
  • Getting one of their rings to use as a measuring tool.
  • Seeking help from friends or family.
  • Getting fitted by a professional jeweler.

settings.question: What are the most durable metals for engagement rings?
settings.answer: Platinum: Highly resilient and non-allergic. White Gold: Generally chic and fashionable with fair resistance to scratching. Yellow and Rose Gold: Timeless and aesthetically pleasing, but soft in comparison with platinum.

settings.question: How can I make a smaller diamond look larger?
settings.answer: Select the halo design, which encircles the centerpiece with smaller diamonds. Prefer longer shapes such as oval, marquise, or pear. Buy the stone with the highest clarity so that it sparkles even more.

settings.question: What is a diamond grading report, and why is it important?
settings.answer: A diamond grading report evaluates a diamond based on the 4 Cs. Good reports from GIA, IGI, and such provide assurance about the quality and worth of the diamond.

settings.question: How should I care for my engagement ring?
settings.answer:
• Regularly wash with warm water and gentle soap.
  • Take it off when performing activities that could potentially scratch or damage the ring.
  • Get professional check-ups at least after every 6-12 months.

settings.question: Can I customize an engagement ring?
settings.answer: For sure! Stienhardt & Stones provide customers with the ability to personalize their suitable ring. They can choose the diamond, setting materials, and metals for the creation of that perfect piece.
